tool.name: Manage Zip
tool.command: manage_zip.sh "$action.select_action" #if $action.select_action == "display" "$action.input_zip" "$log_file" #elif $action.select_action == "create" or $action.select_action == "expand" #if $action.select_action == "create" "$tozip_file" #elif $action.select_action == "expand" "$action.input_zip" #end if "$action.tozip" #for $i in $action.tozip "$i","$i.display_name" #end for #elif $action.select_action == "unpack" "$action.input_zip" "$log_file" "$log_file.id" "$action.extract" #elif $action.select_action == "rename" "$action.input_zip" "$action.source.rename_type" #if $action.source.rename_type == "file" "$action.source.name_table" #elif $action.source.rename_type == "regex" "$action.source.regex_table" #end if #elif $action.select_action == "delete" "$action.input_zip" "$action.remove" #elif $action.select_action == "subset" "$action.input_zip" "$tozip_file" "$action.sub" #end if

param.name: extract
param.label: Files to extract
param.help: File to extract from zip, either provide full names or use wildcards for filematching (*). If no names are provided all contents will be extracted.

param.name: name_table
param.label: Name table
param.help: Name table (in the following csv format "[old name],[new name]")

param.name: regex_table
param.label: List of regular expressions
param.help: List of regular expressions used for renaming files. Use the following format: [string to match]/[string to replace] (without the brackets). Use one regular expression per line, wildcards are allowed. Note: the first regular expression that matches for a file is used, if multiple substitutions are required per file the tools has to be ran several times.

param.name: remove
param.label: Files to delete
param.help: Files to delete from zip, either provide full names or use wildcards for filematching (*)

param.name: sub
param.label: Files to delete
param.help: Files to extract from zip, either provide full names or use wildcards for filematching (*)

tool.help: Manage files in the current history. Extract or create .ZIP files, rename files in bulk or delete non-relevant files.
